name: boxed::convert::<impl core::convert::From<borrow::Cow<'_, [T]>> for boxed::Box<[T]>>::from

core::convert::From::from.doc: Converts to this type from the input type.

borrow::Cow: Unknown([Downcast(VariantIdx(1, ThreadLocalIndex)), Field(0, Ty { id: 586, kind: RigidTy(Adt(AdtDef(DefId { id: 2824, name: "vec::Vec" }), GenericArgs([Type(Ty { id: 110, kind: Param(ParamTy { index: 1, name: "T" }) }), Type(Ty { id: 17, kind: RigidTy(Adt(AdtDef(DefId { id: 2583, name: "alloc::Global" }), GenericArgs([]))) })]))) })])

Unknown([Downcast(VariantIdx(0, ThreadLocalIndex)), Field(0, Ty { id: 575, kind: RigidTy(Ref(Region { kind: ReErased }, Ty { id: 576, kind: RigidTy(Slice(Ty { id: 110, kind: Param(ParamTy { index: 1, name: "T" }) })) }, Not)) })])

doc:
Converts a `Cow<'_, [T]>` into a `Box<[T]>`

 When `cow` is the `Cow::Borrowed` variant, this
 conversion allocates on the heap and copies the
 underlying slice. Otherwise, it will try to reuse the owned
 `Vec`'s allocation.
